name: moonraker
content:
moonraker noun [C]
(SAIL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a square sail at the top of a mast (= a tall pole) on a sailing boat, above the skysail (= usually the top sail on a mast): The moonraker is flown immediately above the skysail on a fully rigged ship.
More examplesFewer examplesA moonraker is square; the equivalent triangular sail is called a skyscraper.

moonraker noun [C]
(PERSON)
UK informal a person who comes from the English county of Wiltshire, especially a smuggler (= a person who secretly and illegally brings goods in and out of a place): He came from a family of moonrakers.
More examplesFewer examplesHe wrote a book called "Memoirs of a Moonraker".My grandparents would tell me the story of the Wiltshire moonrakers.
